website_summaries.verdict: A step up to the previous iteration, the Head Revolt Pro 3 comes with a streamlined shape but equipped with a more stable built. This modified offering is designed with a sturdy and snug upper that’s no longer as stretchy as the second version. It’s covered with a mesh outer membrane that keeps the foot cool through long matches. Given its durable and supportive makeup, it’s one of those shoes that’s suitable for all players from different performance levels.
pros: Lots of users affirm that the Head Revolt Pro 3 provides better stability than the earlier model
A significant number of playtesters say its mesh upper offers a sufficient amount of ventilation
Many of the reviewers love the sleek shape of this version more than the bulkier Head Revolt Pro 2.0
Plenty of happy users claim that this trainer by Head isn’t heavy on foot
Several buyers are pleased that it comes with a 6-month durability warranty
cons: Some reviews say the Revolt 3.0 requires a long break-in time due to its rigid upper
Several users feel that the sole needs more flexibility

customer_reviews.title: Hard to return
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the shoes, they looked great. I ordered size 9 and when they arrived, I could barely get them on as they were narrow and tight fit. I told them I needed the 9.5 and returned the shoes. I received another pair of 9's in the mail, I didn't even try them on as they were exactly same as what I had returned. I returned them and again stated I needed larger size and received word today that another pair of size 9's (replacement) are being sent. Somehow I need to derail this and get the refund as I went out and bought a pair that actually fit.
customer_reviews.author: pepzione

customer_reviews.title: This shoe is the next thing
customer_reviews.text: I don't like everything about this shoe but i love the idea of what its trying to do. As with most new-gen shoes the build quality is very good. It feels extremely strong and long lasting. However you may sacrifice flexibility and movement until you break this shoe completely in.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan W Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Cool looking, rugged tennis shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes ended up looking way cooler than I expected in person. They're super rugged and have a tough outsole which is perfect for an excessive toe dragger like me. Please note, these are best for regular width feet. I have wide feet and I've slightly rolled my ankle twice within a month of regular play. Very infrequent but something to keep in mind. Overall a super well built, stylish pair of shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Head is a brand I've trusted...
customer_reviews.text: ...for 60 years now. Back then it was skis that seemed superior to other manufacturers. Today it's tennis rackets and shoes that I prefer. Whatever the secret of "quality" is, they've known it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Bersche

customer_reviews.title: Great pickleball shoes
customer_reviews.text: Excellent stability and they look great too! Get lots of great comments on the color. Would definitely buy again!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too stiff in soles.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with how shoe feels while playing tennis. Soles hard, almost like hard plastic. Cant move quietly on court. First pair of Head tennis shoes and probably the last.
customer_reviews.author: ray heller

customer_reviews.title: Grippy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: They are very comfortable. I wear a size 10 but I ordered a size 11 because a previous pair were too small. They feel great.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel Mundy

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I thought Head was trailing behind court shoe technology. Not anymore ! Perfect fit, great lateral support and the sole vent works great !
customer_reviews.author: Andres Salazar

customer_reviews.title: Shoe is great.
customer_reviews.text: My second pair and once again they feel and fit great.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Mastro

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit
customer_reviews.text: I have a wider foot and these shoes fit great and feel incredible on the court.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Best tennis shoe ever
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes - best ones I've had so far. I'm a 4.0 player
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Warm shoe
customer_reviews.text: The shoes do not breathe as well as I hoped. Feet run very warm while playing tennis.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Happy feet
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, only had them a few weeks but they are holding up well so far. I like them and every appears to be as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Hody

product_meta.title: HEAD Men's Revolt Pro 3.0 Tennis Shoe, Anthracite/Royal Blue, 42 EU (8 UK)
product_meta.description: The REVOLT PRO 3.0 shoe from HEAD is designed to provide the optimal combination of comfort and stability. It provides maximum comfort and features the TRI-NRG midsole construction, while the straps on the upper provide firm support. The well-protected forefoot with a durable, seamless moulded PU layer makes it perfect for baseline players.
feature_bullets: The HEAD REVOLT PRO 3.0 is a premium all-match performance shoe for playing on the baseline. It still combines the seemingly opposing constellation of comfort and stability.
Durable mesh upper material. PU molded sturdy housing Support of lateral stability. Toe and inner side protection. Adaptive collar padding Built-in TPU heel cup. Comfortable EVA insole
Higher heel for additional cushioning midsole with three degrees of hardness (TRI-NRG) 3D midfoot bridge for optimal torsional rigidity
Hybrid outsole profile for all surfaces, special durable zones for hard court players, open profile zones for best traction on sand, durable, abrasion-resistant rubber, side forefoot stabilizer.
